title: Cannot @InjectMock JsonWebToken since 2.8.0
body:
### Describe the bug

We are using `@InjectMock` (from https://github.com/quarkiverse/quarkus-mockk) to prepare the JWT for tests where we cannot use `@TestSecurity` or WireMock - e.g. in parameterized service tests where the token is depending on the test parameters. 

Since the upgrade to Quarkus 2.8.0.Final the injection fails with an Exception.

### Expected behavior

A mocked instance is injected into the test that can be used.

### Actual behavior

An exception is thrown:
```
Failed to create test instance

``` 

### How to Reproduce?

Simple reproducer:
```kotlin
import io.mockk.every
import io.quarkiverse.test.junit.mockk.InjectMock
import io.quarkus.test.junit.QuarkusTest
import org.assertj.core.api.Assertions.assertThat
import org.eclipse.microprofile.jwt.JsonWebToken
import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test

@QuarkusTest
class SimpleTest {
  @InjectMock lateinit var accessToken: JsonWebToken

  @Test
  fun `should inject token`() {
    every { accessToken.subject } returns "test"

    assertThat(accessToken.subject).isEqualTo("test")
  }
}
```

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-11.0.14+9 (build 11.0.14+9)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.8.{0,1}.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

Gradle 7.4.1

### Additional information

_No response_
